details.name: description
details.old_value:
Lua 5.3.0 "has been released"http://www.lua.org/versions.html#5.3.

Its main new features are support for integers, bitwise operators, and a basic utf-8 library.

It might be wise to upgrade from the current lua 5.2 (released 4 years ago). We should check the "changes":http://www.lua.org/manual/5.3/readme.html#changes and ensure the current Lua scripts still work correctly. At first sight, I don't think they'd need lot of rework, if any.

Its main new features are support for integers, bitwise operators, and a basic utf-8 library.

It might be wise to upgrade from the current lua 5.2 (released 4 years ago). We should check the "changes":http://www.lua.org/manual/5.3/readme.html#changes and ensure the current Lua scripts still work correctly. At first sight, I don't think they'd need lot of rework, if any.

subject: update to Lua 5.3.0
description:
Lua 5.3.0 "has been released":http://www.lua.org/versions.html#5.3.

Its main new features are support for integers, bitwise operators, and a basic utf-8 library.

It might be wise to upgrade from the current lua 5.2 (released 4 years ago). We should check the "changes":http://www.lua.org/manual/5.3/readme.html#changes and ensure the current Lua scripts still work correctly. At first sight, I don't think they'd need lot of rework, if any.
